page.title: 16Social concern - Old people
page.content: There are three other residential homes for the elderly, all sited in the vicinity of St. Mary's church. Applethwaite Green is run by the South Lakeland District Council and provides full care facilities, while nearby Birthwaite, also council-run, provides warden-assisted sheltered housing in the form of small, self-contained flats. A new extension has just been opened. Almost next door is one of the privately run Abbeyfield homes. Windermere is a popular area to which to retire and the age 'pyramid' of the local population shows a definite bulge in the over 55's. The provision of suitable accomodation for the elderly in the area is therefore important, although many will be financially independant.
